intro: Helleborine rubra, commonly known as the red helleborine, is a species of orchid native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its dark green, strap-like leaves and its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Helleborine rubra is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora.
